Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.1125 units, resulting in a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge and a flat bottom edge. **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a pointed end.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2223, 0.0, 0.013] Next, create the 2D sketch for this part: Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.45, 0.0] - Line 2: Starting at [0.45, 0.0], ending at [0.45, 0.225] - Line 3: Starting at [0.45, 0.225], ending at [0.0, 0.0] Now, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0281 units, then extrude it in the opposite direction by 0.0281 units, resulting in a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a pointed end. Note that the model is centered and has a slight tilt to the left as described in the final shape. The height, width and length of each intermediate part and final shape are provided in their respective descriptions. These values can be used to ensure accuracy during the CAD modeling process.</description>
